moving

Class MeleeWeapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.Item
      • moving.Weapon
        • moving.MeleeWeapon

  • public class MeleeWeapon
extends Weapon
    A Melee Weapon. Has some special properties such as arcLength and swingSpeed, unique to melee weapons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeleeWeapon

        public MeleeWeapon(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String description,
           int xOnMap,
           int yOnMap,
           boolean isOnMap,
           double attSpeed,
           int[] damage,
           int arcLength,
           int swingSpeed,
           boolean piercesEnemies,
           boolean piercesWalls,
           java.awt.Image img,
           java.awt.Image shotImage)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the melee weapon.
        description - The description of the melee weapon.
        xOnMap - The x-location of the weapon on the map, if it is on the map.
        yOnMap - The y-location of the weapon on the map, if it is on the map.
        isOnMap - Whether the item is on the map or not.
        attSpeed - The weapon's attack speed increase.
        damage - The weapon's damage, represented by an int array of two values (lower bound - upper bound)
        arcLength - The arc length of the weapon, in degrees.
        swingSpeed - The swing speed of the weapon, in degrees/frame (each frame is 1/60th of a second approximately).
        piercesEnemies - Whether this weapon pierces enemies (hits multiple enemies or not).
        piercesWalls - Whether this weapon pierces walls (can hit multiple blocks or not).
        img - The Weapon's icon.
        shotImage - The weapon's bullet image.

    • Method Detail

      • setReferencePoint

        public void setReferencePoint(java.lang.Object referencePoint)
        Sets the reference point for this weapon. THIS MUST BE CALLED IMMEDIATELY AFTER CREATING A MELEE WEAPON!
        Parameters:
        referencePoint - The Object which the weapon is bound to.

      • getShotsToAdd

        public Shot[] getShotsToAdd(int xAdd,
                   int yAdd,
                   double angle,
                   Game myGame)
        Returns an array of shots to add to the game. This is called when the melee weapon is "swung" or "fired".
        Overrides:
        getShotsToAdd in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        xAdd - The x position of the shot.
        yAdd - The y position of the shot.
        angle - The angle at which the shot is fired.
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.
        Returns:
        An array of Shots to add to the Game.
